cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, expected to turn NNE on Wednesday and then accelerate northeastward across the southeastern U.S. and up the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (near the Steinhatchee River/Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound, GA, to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane warnings in effect along Florida’s west coast from Bonita Beach to the Aucilla River, including Tampa Bay; tropical-storm warnings extend northward to the mouth of the St. Marys River, GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts, then Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coastline (including New York Bight)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty E–SE winds 20–30 mph Friday morning; low 4 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (1–2 ft) possible at high tide in the New York Bight and back‐bay areas
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, leading to brief urban/poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk in outer rain bands; reduced visibilities and heavy showers could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations
